Package game.movegeneration.pieces

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
game.movegeneration.pieces.Pawn
All Implemented Interfaces:
PieceI
public class Pawn extends Object implements PieceI
The Pawn class represents the Pawn chess piece and implements the PieceI interface.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryu

  • Method Details

    • getPieceType

      public int getPieceType()
      Description copied from interface: PieceI
      Returns a unique identifier for each piece type. 0 for empty, 1 for pawn, 2 for knight, 3 for bishop, 4 for rook, 5 for queen, 6 for king
      Specified by:
      getPieceType in interface PieceI
      Returns:
      The piece type identifier.

    • generateMove

      public long generateMove(int from, boolean isWhite, GameState previousGameState)
      Description copied from interface: PieceI
      Generates legal moves for the piece from the given position.
      Specified by:
      generateMove in interface PieceI
      Parameters:
      from - The starting position of the piece.
      isWhite - Whether the piece is white.
      previousGameState - The previous game state for move generation.
      Returns:
      A bitboard representing possible moves.

    • generateSamePieceAttacks

      public static long generateSamePieceAttacks(boolean isWhite)
      Generates attacks for the pawn of the same color on the board. Uses BitBoards to retrieve additional Piece Information and as such is static
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Whether the pawn is white.
      Returns:
      Bitboard representing possible attacks.
